paper.title: Area-Time Optimal VLSI Networks for Computing Integer Multiplications and Discrete Fourier Transform
paper.venue: International Colloquium on Automata, Languages and Programming
paper.abstract: In this paper we present a class of VLSI networks for computing the Discrete Fourier Transform and the product of two N-bit integers. These networks match, within a constant factor, the known theoretical lower-bound O(N2) to the area × (time)2 measure of complexity. While this paperu0027s contribution is mainly theoretical, it points toward very practical directions: we show how to design multipliers with area A = O(N) and time T=O(√N) on one hand, and A=0((N/log2N)2), T = O(log2N) on the other. Both of these designs should be contrasted with the currently available multipliers, whose performances are A=O(N), T=O(N) or even A=O(N2), T=O(N).
